title: Deal Lead
description:
EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  

The Deal Leader (DL) Director rank, leads the most strategic, complex, and largest pursuits (e.g. assurance/audit) in the Area portfolio across all key phases, up until close. The objectives and purpose of the Deal Leader role is to develop and execute the pursuit strategy through exceptional leadership, expereinced deal accumen, broad commercial saviness, and a strategic mindset to properly position the firm’s strongest win-win value proposition to the client to win new business opportunities.

  

To those objectives, the role is responsible for actively leading the pursuit and process with a bias for action, infusing large complex deal expereince and know-how to elevate pursuit team thinking on the win strategy and pricing.

 **The opportunity**

  

The Deal Leader has responsibility for mobilizing the right pursuit skills and team, and collaborating with key stakeholders to effectively respond to the potential client’s needs and opportunity. This role assesses, makes recommendations, and updates Area Pursuit and BD Leadership, Client Service Partners and Firm leadership to continue or stop the opportunity/pursuit.

  



**Your key responsibilities**

  

* Support global priority pursuits resulting in contracted “win” sales revenue in excess of the $50mm Total Contract Value(TCV)
* Provides leadership in the design, development and execution of pursuits, obtaining comphehensive pursuit knowledge to make informed recommendations and decisions (e.g., win strategy, client requirements/needs, competitive analysis, solution, pricing for value, commercial deal principles, Client facing deal assumptions, and Client/EY stakeholder engagement)
* Executes firm’s Gold Standard Pursuit Process (GSPP) throughout pursuit with key stakeholders, continuously confirming expectations and outcomes are aligned between Client and EY
* Assesses pursuit team skills, resources and level of support required for pursuit, providing best opportunity to win
* Provides leadership, coaching, and mentoring across all team members executing against pursuit process (Pursuit Team, Service Line, Delivery, Account Team, etc.), developing high-performing pursuit teams
* Drives the momentum of pursuits and team members to make certain that deliverables are met, duties are shared appropriately, and enthusiasm and motivation remain high
* Drives quality and efficiencies through pursuit process and controls, delivering highest quality end product
* Engages and manages EY senior leadership throughout the pursuit and approvals, articulating with clarity, win themes, sources of client value delivered, competitive positioning, solution details, deal economics, commercial considerations, and deal risk (e.g., economic, reputation, media, relationship)

 **Others**:

  

* Supports the transfer of pursuit knowledge, learnings, and client relationships to delivery teams, ensuring the ongoing management of the commercial aspects of contracts
* Conducts formal win/loss reviews to capture knowledge, improving future strategic pursuits (e.g., deal structures and terms)
* Participates in EY training sessions and events, sharing of success stories across the firm to showcase “gold standard” deal execution
* Delivers formal feedback to pursuit team members during and post pursuit, including, but not limited to the Global Client Service Partner (GCSP), Center of Excellence (COE) individuals, other Pursuits Group team members, etc

 **Analytical/Decision Making responsibilities:**

  

* Executes firm’s Gold Standard Pursuit Process (GSPP), determining whether of not EY should start or continue expending resources towards a pursuit relative to client commitment and understanding (e.g., timing is right, is a priority when matched against other initiatives, urgency/burning platform, committed executive sponsor and known Buyers, client willingness to provide information/data, and agreed to decision criteria, process, and timeline)
* Identifies and clearly articulates value beyond quantifiable cost reduction into other, often harder to quantify value components (e.g., improved service, risk reduction, etc.
* Shapes the right deal through ongoing evaluation of the intersection of scope, pricing, and terms from submission to selection. Understanding any proposed variations or adjustments to EY’s offer necessitate our ability to make appropriate counter-balancing adjustments (e.g., more fees for more risk or scope and vice – versa)

 **Skills and attributes for success**

  

To qualify for the role you must have

* Has “consultative” client-service mindset from professional services or strategic sourcing experience
* Proven Business transformation, IT transformation, and strategic sourcing pursuit execution in fast-paced, collaborative, or deal-making environment
* Experienced working in a geographically spread business and agile work environment
* Exhibits key principles and practices of other pursuit roles (e.g., deal manager, solution architect, commercial architect, lead negotiator, and creative designer):
* Client-centric pursuit messaging and win themes
* Lead negotiations in a disciplined fashion to optimize the outcome for EY
* Client centered end-to-end visual communication strategies to convey EY’s win themes
* Skilled in identifying sources of expected client value creation to differentiate EY from other alternatives
* Has strong individual presence leading and working across teams, developing trusted relationships based on thought leadership and extensive pursuit experience and deal acumen
* Skilled at “connecting the dots” across multiple dimensions of pursuit execution, with insightful perspective to anticipate (e.g., see around the corner), navigate complex situations, and shape EY’s response to the client buying needs
* Brings relevant quantitative and qualitative commercial acumen to lead pursuit teams define and distinguish a good deal
* Influences pursuit team to assess and use the full breadth and depth of EY’s experiences, capabilities, and resources to best position EY to win
* Demonstrates high level of credibility to influence key EY and client stakeholders on pursuit and deal strategies & outcomes, including boardroom gravitas (able to influence without authority) - personal style, experience and approach
* Produces consistently high-quality outcomes meeting time-sensitive commitments
* Has excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

 **Supervision Responsibilities:**

  

* Works as individual contributor operating with considerable autonomy and minimal direction in leading pursuits
* Serves as a Counselor and/or reviewer to other pursuit team members
* Coaches resources including client serving who do not reside within the BD organization and will be expected to inspire others through action in the marketplace

 **Other Requirements:**

  

* Embraces shared philosophy that “great teams” execute a consistent set of behaviors aligned with being a:  

o Trusted Strategic Advisor – Build Trust and credibility by proactively providing forward-thinking insights and guidance to help pursuit teams develop and execute a winning pursuit strategy  

o Gold Standard Champion – Execute EY’s “gold standard” pursuit process process with discipline and expertise to improve consistency and use of leading practices in EY’s approach to winning  

o Win-Win Advocate – Drive internal and external clients towards outcomes that deliver compelling and sustainable results for both the client and EY  

o Creativity and innovation Driver – Inspire and challenge teams to differentiate EY through innovative strategies, experiences, and deliverables that compel our clients to choose EY  

o Inspirational Change Agent – Invest in developing world-class talent, methods, tools, and capabilities to deliver better results, create exceptional experiences, and develop transformative leaders and teams
* Moderate to frequent travel will be required

 **Ideally, you’ll also have**

  

* University/Bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualification required, MBA or master’s degree (or equivalent qualification) in Business, Accounting, IT or related field preferred
* 15+ years expereince with complex deals through formal procurement-led pursuits (e.g. RFPs) and non-RFP sole source pursuits
* 10+ years of experience leading multi-geography strategic and commercially complex pursuits, working in a delivery environment with multiple resourcing capabilities (e.g., onshore, nearshore, offshore, consulting, strategy)
* Full pursuit life cycle experience from opportunity identification through to contract close
* Preferred working knowledge of finance, assurance/audit, banking, risk, compliance or tax processes

Preferred execution experience in assurance/audit or commercially complex deals  
* 

**What we offer**

  

The compensation ranges below are provided in order to comply with United States pay transparency laws. Other geographies will follow their local salary guidelines, which may not be a direct conversion of published US salary range/s. We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $298,200 to $574,000. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $357,800 to $652,300. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.

* **Continuous learning:** You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* **Success as defined by you:** We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* **Transformative leadership:** We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* **Diverse and inclusive culture:** You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

  

EY accepts applications for this position on an on-going basis. **If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.**

  

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

  

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

  

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

description:
Eko is an innovative e-commerce startup, dedicated to empowering brands to create, display, and optimize their video assets across digital platforms. Over the past two years, we've refined our technology, working closely with esteemed clients such as Walmart, Lego, and Mattel. Through these collaborations, Eko has earned a reputation for delivering exceptional product visuals that enhance the e-commerce experience and drive sales.



As we enter our next phase of expansion, we are seeking a Sales Executive. This role is pivotal; you'll take the proven playbook developed by our founders and amplify it, propelling us to new heights. You'll be expected to generate your own prospects, hunt down opportunities, and close deals without an SDR team, but with a product that works and a wealth of data points to support it.



If you have a creative mindset, thrive in networking environments, and can apply strategic thinking to negotiate deal terms, this is the perfect opportunity. It's a blue ocean market with real pain points waiting to be solved, and you could be the one to drive that change.



This role is ideal for someone with existing rolodex and industry knowledge but we believe that motivation and talent can bridge the gap.

  


**WHAT YOU'LL DO…**


* Identify and generate new business opportunities.
* Conduct discovery calls to understand potential client's needs and requirements.
* Deliver engaging and effective product demonstrations to prospective clients.
* Develop and maintain a robust sales pipeline to ensure continuous growth.
* Close deals and achieve or exceed sales targets.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders and decision-makers.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to develop strategies for lead generation and brand awareness.
* Provide feedback and insights to the product and development teams to improve our offerings based on customer needs.
* Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and trade shows.

  


**OUR DREAM CANDIDATE HAS…**


* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
* **Minimum of 5 years of experience in hands-on sales**, **with a focus on SaaS and e-commerce companies.**
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.


The OTE compensation for this position is $180,000-$200,000/year with an option to **over-achieve**. The base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.


**WHO WE ARE**



At Eko, we're hiring people, not just skills. If you possess some of the qualities we're looking for but not all, and still feel you're a great fit, we encourage you to apply. At eko, we believe in a creative approach to everything, no matter what role we're in. We believe in meaningful choice, both at work and in life, and know our workplace only gets better when people can bring their whole selves to the office. We have offices in NYC, TLV, and an AI-powered Robotic studio in Bentonville. We're software developers and spray paint artists, poets and producers, fantasy sports fans and financial whizzes, chess-heads and UXperts, pop culture nerds and product managers, data wizards and yoga instructors. We're passionate about art, entertainment, technology and everything in between. It's our unique mix of talents and passions that puts us at the forefront of interactive video.
